characters: -- THE GRENADES EXPLODE. TWO OFFICERS BLOWN TO OBLIVION -
WE ARE LOOKING THROUGH A TELEPHOTO LENS.
MEGAPHONES FOR VEHICLES TO PULL OVER AND LET THE CONVOY P
-- WE ARE UNDERNEATH THE PLYWOOD, FLASHLIGHT IN OUR EYES
--THROUGH THE BINOCULARS WE LOOK OVER JUAREZ--
A MAN POINTING A SHOTGUN AT HER.
SIRENS BLARE. POLICE YELL OVER LOUD SPEAKERS AND THROUGH
A MEXICAN STATE POLICE OFFICER 5 FEET FROM HER WINDOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE ARE RIGHT BEHIND THE WOMAN, who mumbles the prayer as runs. The back of her vest reads: FBI. Her name is KATE M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us this day... our daily bread...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the door, a shotgun BLASTS THE HINGES. It fall like a drawbridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She speaks the prayer faster, desperate to finish before has to kill anyone, or be killed herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And lead us not into temptation but deliver us from evil...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT officers rush in, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy's turn: She runs through the busted door-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the hallway now. The chaos is closer. She hurries the words. So close now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Thine is the Kingdom the power and glory forever and ever amen DOWN MOTHER FUCKER!! DOWN DOWN DOWN!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two LATINO MEN, 20'S, are slammed to the ground. Another LATINO comes from nowhere, throwing himself on an AFRICAN AMERICAN MAN wearing an FBI vest. A taser is pressed to h neck and he falls, paralyzed, backward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy takes in the chaos, then pushes farther into the hou running past a bedroom with an open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the corner of her eye she sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ducks as a SHOTGUN BLAST rips 10 inches of dry wall a her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, pressing the CAMERA against the wall. We watch over her shoulder as she returns fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rooster tail of shell casings are thrown over us, invad our view. Bullet after bullet pound him. The man's knees give. He's falling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A round hits him in the face and he is thrown back -- blo brain, and skull fragments explode like shrapnel on the w behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrenaline hits her like a fever. She gets dizzy, sits against the wall, gasping for breath. A SWAT officer rush to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU HIT??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT officer looks at the hole in the drywall. Leans forward. Looks closer... What the fuck IS that??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face now inches from the hole then jumps back like he bitten by a snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT THE FUCK??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SKULL OF A MAN. Dry skin sunken into bones like cellophane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy stands up and turns around. Looks at it. Trying to process what she's seeing. She walks up and starts pullin the drywall. Other officers join her. They yank and tear six foot hole in the wall, then stand back, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bodies are standing side by side. A lime-green dust has spilled out on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire house is a tomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy sits on the porch. Swallows water from a bottle. Hol it down maybe ten seconds. Vomits... We see another SWAT OFFICER doing the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI AGENT REGGIE WAYNE, 30, African American, walks from house, fighting the same urge. Sits beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't shake the smell. Just sits in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Sorry I wasn't on your six. Got wrapped up in the front room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks out over the sea of POLICE VEHICLES on the stre and spots PHOENIX HOMICIDE DETECTIVE LANCE ALVAREZ, 45, heading right for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loan you SWAT and you hand us three dozen homicides. I oughta fucking pepper spray you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't smell any worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha. You're not the one gotta clean this shit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thirty families without a father's real funny, but you keep worrying about what it does to your weekend, Lance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen you fucking   --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie is on his feet in an instant and inches from Lance face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't hear you, you say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance swallows his anger and his pride, walks toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear your people out, it's our crime scene now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your crime scene when I GIVE IT TO YOU!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the chances they'll put together a case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... None.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and sees: FBI REGIONAL DIRECTOR DAVE JENNINGS, leather skin stretched over a square jaw that rests on br shoulders. Beside him is DEPUTY DIRECTOR PHIL COOPER, 40, balding and thin, exactly the man you want analyzing data

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever seen him at a crime scene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennings and Phil reach her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna give me the tour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't but she will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No dry wall anywhere now: the walls have been stripped to frame, exposing another DOZEN BODIES. CORONERS in protect suits remove them as DETECTIVES photograph the scene. The smell is atrocious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like Sinaloa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennings nods and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (To a coroner) How many total?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between here and the hall we have thirty, but there's more in the back bedroom and we haven't looked in the attic or under the crawl space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Phil) Call DOJ in Washington, let em know what we have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil nods, pulls his cell and steps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one of the houses owned by Manuel Diaz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way to connect him, but he owns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smell is getting to Reggie. Doesn't look like he's go to make it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and step out, it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't have to tell him twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennings walks to the wall. Studies the faces -- one in particular, tinted an ashy green from lye and months of d -- his mouth open wide and eyes shut so tight that his br is a tangle of wrinkles, as though he is suffering his de for eternity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a GARAGE, and to it's left A STORAGE SHED. AN OFFI yanks boxes and garbage from it, tossing it on the drivew He reaches the floor, which is covered with rubber matts. pulls one up and discovers a 3' X 3' piece of plywood hin to the floor and locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I NEED BOLT CUTTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are brought over and the lock is cut. The officer kn down. Lifts the hatch a little. Looks under, flashlight i hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the hatch is lifted -- TWO HOOKS with wires are visibl our left and right. As the hatch is lifted, the wires pul tighter... We see where they lead: TWO GRENADES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennings and Macy walk down the hall. Jennings stops at t body of the man Macy killed, then notices --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a screen door at the end of the hall -- officers rushing toward the shed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PD found something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy and Jennings walk outside. As the sunlight hits them the officer open the hatch, the wires pull tight and we h a `clink'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust, debris, smoke, and pieces of them roll toward Jenni and Macy like a wave, swallowing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our entire world is filled with a brown cloud and screams

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see children splashing and playing in a large pool thr enormous windows in MANUEL DIAZ'S living room. As we pull back, we hear the sounds of a NEWS REPORT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix police have released no details, but there HAS BEEN an explosion at a house in South Phoenix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PIVOTS and we are looking at a TV across a flawles decorated living room. Aerial footage of the tract house obliterated storage plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can clearly see two bodies covered in tarps but Phoenix Police will not release names or even confirm the deaths. Witnesses on the scene state that a warrant was served at the house an hour BEFORE the explosion, so the speculation is the deceased are Phoenix police

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN leans into frame. His head slowly shakes as he watc and listens. A cell phone rings. He answers it, mutes the and retreats out of frame, leaving us to watch the news i silence, as the sounds of children splashing and laughing wafts in through an open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stare at the spout. Water washes over us. We look at t drain. Dirt, blood, and small fragments of pink, white, a navy blue circle the drain as gravity carries them to the sewers of Phoenix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark brown hair is vigorously scrubbed. Macy does not rel in this shower-- that is not its purpose. The purpose is decontaminate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy stands in front of the mirror, brushing her hair. Th are abrasions on her cheek and a deep cut that runs down the corner of her eye-- like she cried a scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hair brush catches. Pulls her head back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She extracts the brush. Feels around on her scalp and retrieves a piece of bone. Looks at it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wraps it in toilet paper, sets it on the counter, and gets back in the shower. Turns it on. Gonna try this agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The decor is Spare. Functional and nothing more. Doesn't tease herself with pictures on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy walks in wearing a large men's t shirt, nothing else Her COMPUTER CHIRPS. ROSALYN4620 is asking that she chat. Macy looks at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeps walking. Her cell phone rings. Call display: MOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh... (Answers it) Mom, it was a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone sure missed you today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy's body tenses and deflates at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. You get my card?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the computer. I want to see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I just got --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my birthday goddammit-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm signing on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hits a button on her computer and ROSALYN MACY, 60 to appears. She leans back and forth in front of the lens, s unsure about this technology that beams her image through space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay in one place, Mom. Happy birthday. Sorry I didn't call-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see me? I don't see you. Lean forward -- there you are... What happened to your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalyn's happy mood is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. It's something on your lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate. I can see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, rough day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a waste of a law degree, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy holds her tongue, but it takes effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who came to the party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan sent me a card. I thought that was very sweet. Have you two spoken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I hope you two will become friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure we'll be great friends, Mother. Nothing like a divorce to bring people closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am... (forces a smile) Happy birthday. How does it feel to be 60?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would feel a lot better with a grandchild, and I don't think it's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy slams the laptop closed. She rubs her eyes... So tir Her cell phone rings. She flips it open, angry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I DON'T WANT TO TALK ABOUT GRANDCHILDREN. (It isn't mom) Yeah, umm... I can, I can be there in, say thirty minutes? Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hangs up. Day's not over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy and Reggie sit in chairs against a glass wall. NEWS FOOTAGE of the blast plays on monitors along the wall of command center filled with activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the glass office behind them, a dozen men in suits. Jennings, in the same shape as Macy, has deflated into a chair, Phil sitting beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy turns and looks through the wall at the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennings makes eye contact with Macy through the glass. F the first time, he seems old to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these men look important, except one: MATT GRAVES, 40 golf shirt, bit of a belly, red, shaggy hair -- looks lik tourist. His demeanor is easy, you almost get the sense h having fun. Macy turns around and rests her head against glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did this by the book, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on ... Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy lets out a heavy breath, looks back through the glas find: every man in the room is STARING RIGHT AT HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?(Turns around) Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil walks toward them, pushes open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you step in here, Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises and shares a look with Reggie. The door closes behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt smiles, friendly. A man in his 40's, military haircu BURNETT, looks her over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a find today ... The loss of two officers not withstanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How familiar are you with Manuel Diaz's operation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His company, Sun Valley, owns eighty or so foreclosure properties, another --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about his brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um ... Wasn't aware he had one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillermo... Mexican police are holding him in Juarez. What do you know about his cousin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know he had one of those either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His cousin is Fausto Alarcon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number three in the Sinaloa Cartel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manuel Diaz is likely their most senior member in the United States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy feels woefully unprepared for an inquisition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of this is in his file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With good reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loose lips sink ships, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Macy doesn't work narcotics, she runs a kidnapping response team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is this clown in the golf shirt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divorced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He works for Border Patrol and got to keep the condo and my Bronco, anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt smiles. Phil stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Kate, if you could wait outside, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands there for a beat, utterly confused, then leave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits back down next to Reggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch the men speaking through the glass, then they al file out of the office except Jennings and Matt. Phil sta at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you come in, Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks in and stands across from Jennings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOJ wants advisors that focus on cartels involved in pursuing Mr. Diaz. This is Matt Graves. He'll be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be leading who? This is Phoenix Homicide now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're expanding the scope of the investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll act as a liaison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: State Department is pulling an agent from the field that specializes in responding to escalated cartel activity. You'll meet up with them...(To Matt) at Luke, Tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day after. Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke ... Air Force base?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna go see Guillermo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt smiles, like they're discussing renovating a kitchen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... If I, umm... What's our objective?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our objective is to dramatically overreact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why isn't Reggie in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a little green. You've been kicking doors longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back at Reggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes you feel better to have him around, he can tag along after we get back from El Paso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles. She takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate. You must volunteer for an interagency task force... Think very hard before you respond ... You want to be a part of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennings' eyes beg her to say no. But the hunter in her i awake. She looks back at Reggie -- his eyes are full of concern...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get an opportunity at the men responsible for today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men who are REALLY responsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then yeah, sure. I'll volunteer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennings looks at her. Nods. She is theirs now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning sun hits closed eyes. Dark, fat face. Beads of sw on his brow and cheeks. Thick mustache. His name is SILVI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHADOW falls over him. He feels it. Eyes pop open, tens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile crosses Silvio's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despirtate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silvio closes his eyes. The little boy taps him on the ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silvio's smile grows. It is a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the boy now. He is eight. Bright brown eyes. His n is ELISEO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SI!! Tengo un juego de futbol!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silvio acts surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy laughs and grabs his father's hand, tugging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si Papa! Tenemos que ir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy pulls with all his might. Silvio makes a show of resisting, then climbs out of bed. Eliseo keeps a tight h of his hand, and walks him down a hall to a small kitchen with adobe walls and a dirt floor. An opening leads to a small patio that now serves mostly as a chicken coop. Two chickens are in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman stands over a stove, cooking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa necessita cafe y juevos! Tenemos priso mama!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and smiles at her son, the bright star in her b life. Her eyes pass over Silvio. She stopped loving him y ago, but he adores their little boy... At least they have that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down. She scoops eggs onto a plate with tortillas drops it in front of him. Hands him a coffee. He sniffs i hands it back. Without a word she pours in two fingers of tequila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy stares at his father with endless joy. No idea ho unlucky he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silvio stares back, winks. The boy smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silvio and Eliseo exit the house. Silvio wears a State Po uniform, dressed to intimidate. The boy wears his uniform dressed to play soccer. They walk past cinder-block house one after the other, cracked and faded from the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tejano music, car horns, and distant yelling penetrate th morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two ARMORED PERSONNEL CARRIERS drive past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silvio and Eliseo wander away, Eliseo's tiny hand clingin Silvio's police belt. Eliseo has his father for the whole and he isn't letting go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and disappear around the corner. Only thing on street is a stray dog burying itself in an overturned tra can... The mascot of this dying city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are back with Alejandro, holding a man under water. Fa to the sun, somehow able to focus fully on the task at ha while escaping to someplace else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets the man up. Coughing, heaving up salt water, and sobbing. He looks at Alejandro with the pleading eyes of man whose will has been broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Guteman. Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course me too! If the Americans would leave, you would see... no one is pure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro lets the man up and pushes him toward the shore now see the man wears a MILITARY UNIFORM. He walks ahead Alejandro, looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man makes a half hearted attempt at attacking Alejand who pushes and spins him like a defiant child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk a few steps and the man tries it again. Alejand appears only half committed to the sloppy assault. Alejan slaps the man across the face, then pushes him forward, slapping the back of his head as he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach a stump where Alejandro's linen coat rests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't walk back like this. We need to dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit back and bathe in the sun. The man is uncomforta kidnapper and captive, lounging on the shore. He consider running. Considers fighting him again, but settles on res his tired back against the stump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will you do with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I be arrested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will you do with the Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. (Alejandro turns his face to the sun) I just wanted to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro and the man walk along a two track road through field of sugar cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you tell. They will kill me... my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me a reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I avoid that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By telling me the truth without having to drown you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come around a bend and we see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Structures built in simple but orderly rows. Humvees, one after the other, parked neatly in front. Soldiers move ab Colombia may be corrupt, but they are orderly about it. N of the filth and chaos of northern Mexico. They have been it much longer, with battle lines very clearly drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man turns to Alejandro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... that's it then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You act like the Narcos. You do things that I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro offers him a polite smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you are very lucky you never will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man walks away, turning back occasionally to see if h truly free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro turns in another direction, spots THREE US MARI HUMVEES, EIGHT MARINES BESIDE THEM. Matt stands in front. They walk toward each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get to that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro looks over the Marines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why so many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't want anything to happen to you on the way to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To keep my promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro's kind, hollow eyes almost show emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did they do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. It leads to Fausto. And I'm going to turn you loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro stands for a moment. The tiniest hint of a smil curls his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie drives, Macy riding shotgun. Through the windshiel we see the entrance to LUKE AIR FORCE BASE approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're back tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'll call you, let you know what time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand why they don't want me there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She deflects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's El Paso... Don't think you're missing much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... you keep your eye on that doughy prick in the golf shirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to worry about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't what we do, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do what we need to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie pulls to the guard post, hands over their ID's. An FORCE MP takes them, compares ID's to a list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Reggie) You're not on here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. What's she supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy opens the door and steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you when we're heading back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks around the front of the Tahoe and disappears wi the MP into the guard house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy walks toward the runways, looking around, unsure whe to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, sees Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We just landed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks to him and they head off. Alejandro sits on a bench, patiently. They walk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my bird dog, his name's Alejandro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate Macy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro studies her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been to Juarez before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Wait, we're going to El Paso, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we'll talk about it on the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off, they follow. He leads them to a GULFSTREAM G650.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're taking this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really... Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They strap themselves in as the pilot speaks with the tow Macy sits beside Alejandro. Studies him. He looks like a doctor or accountant, but there is an absent manner to hi actions, as though nothing warrants his full attention bu the weight of his thoughts. He catches her looking at him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your experience with operations like these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None... What IS the operation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a polite smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep if you can. Juarez will demand all of your focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lays his head back and closes his eyes. Macy looks at Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going into Juarez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shakes his head. Could be interpreted as a `no'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOD flies around in Gulfstreams now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys don't have one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... Food on this flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got some bitchin peanuts in the back. Kind of a self-serve deal though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his head back, closes his eyes. She looks over at Alejandro who is already asleep. Macy's wired. No chance sleep. Pulls a magazine from the seat back as the plane begins to taxi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE: Alejandro's face in profile. Sunlight spilling ov him through a small window. He looks different. Softer... Happy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARK BROWN HAIR lowers into frame toward him. He pushes i back, revealing a young woman. She smiles and kisses him. lets her hair fall as the kiss grows. Dark hair fills the frame...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets very still. Darker now. Sunlight is gone. We PULL BACK. Farther. Farther still. See the woman's body. She l face down in a hallway, naked. Blood pooled beneath her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a HEART BEAT. We move down a hall. Heart beating FASTER. Past a MEXICAN POLICE OFFICER, who somberly watch us... At the end of the hall we hear something rubbing, swaying. We move faster. Heart beats faster. Racing now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to the end of the hall, the SWAYING IS LOUDER. We tu left, push open a door. Look up -- The swaying sound is a ROPE. It swings in and out of frame. We follow it down -- LIFELESS BODY OF A YOUNG GIRL at the end of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro jolts awake, slamming his hands into the seat i front of him -- scaring the living shit out of Macy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESUS!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro looks straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look at her. Sweat rolls down his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps looking at him. He turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the pilot announce their initial descent into El Paso's FORT BLISS. Alejandro leans back in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... This is your specialty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said the cartels in Mexico are your specialty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything I should know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are asking how a watch works. For now, only focus on knowing the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro lays his head back. Closes his eyes. Macy mumbl to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Yoda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro, Macy, and Matt walk off the plane, blinded by desert sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man in his late 30's, mustache, DEA AGENT STEVE FERSING waves from inside a BLACK CHEVY TAHOE. They walk over and climb in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Trying to get DOD to let me look into this conspiracy to sink Figi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the damn terrorists. They're sinking all the tropical islands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure a month or two there, I could get it worked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear there's a real drug problem at the Four Seasons there. You need any help looking into it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll keep you posted... who's going over today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshals, DEA. Pulled a team for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get all warm and fuzzy when you say `team'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a crack bunch too. Just rotated back from Afghanistan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's everybody linking up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Army Intelligence Center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy listens intently, trying to figure out what the hell they're talking about. Alejandro looks out across the bor Alejandro seems different. He is somewhere else. Somewher bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWENTY FOOT WALLS surround the center. A GUARD POST in fr of an enormous closed gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tahoe pulls up... A guard, dressed like he is on miss in Afghanistan, steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ID's all around. Hey Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Steve hands his ID. The guard returns to the guard h with the IDs. Matt turns around and faces Macy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you were in the big time in Phoenix... welcome to Baghdad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard returns with their IDs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gate opens and they pull in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be fifty vehicles, most are unmarked SUVs, but dozen Humvees and six ARMORED PERSONNEL CARRIERS, complet with 20mm cannons. The area is alive with activity. Agent deputies, and special forces operators are moving about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tahoe parks and our team gets out. They follow Steve toward the entrance to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A US MARSHAL stands in front of a video screen showing th route into and out of Juarez. Twenty men seated in chairs None wear uniforms, but all wear tactical vests, drop-leg holsters, assault rifles by there side. It sounds and loo like a military operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take a seat in the back. Macy the men seated around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is surprised by the directive, turns her focus to the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mexican Federal Police will meet you at the border and proceed with you to the courthouse located (Pointing on map) here. This is a high level target. The most likely spot for an attempt will be at the exchange and the border. The Marshals will enter -- Kevin, Keith, wanna stand up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men in their 50's stand up. They look like they were teleported from another time -- starched white shirts und bullet proof vests, starched Wranglers, bone colored cowb hats, and faces tough as boot leather. They turn to the r without smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Smiling) Man, I love Texans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro whispers to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Memorize the faces of everyone here. Know who is with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshals' response team is in Laredo so, our friends from Delta have volunteered to come along and will escort the Marshals at the exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marshal speaking notices Matt in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the man of the hour. You coming or waiting here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, we'll take the tour. Loan me a couple of pop guns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is turning into an All-Star affair. Wanna another hand at the exchange, Keith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Matt) You sober?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will be by the time we get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a bottle in the truck in case yer hands git to shakin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss your hospitality, Keith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns to Macy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess we're going sightseeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy looks very uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. So, and we'll gear you up when we're done, Matt -- you can be the tip of the spear and we don't have to rob a guy from Delta... Be careful on the turn-around -- if a Federale is a shooter it will be on the turn around. Ray, your Team 1 is lead vehicle and we can divide team 2 into the carry car and the trail vehicles, that okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man with a short beard and very broad shoulders nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, If Delta could stand up so everyone can see who to stand behind if the shit hits the fan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs. The Delta operators rise. Though this is room of professionals, these men truly look like the ones want to stand behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most likely spot for a hit is at the border crossing on the return. State Police has agree to hold a lane for you. Heads up if they don't... Anywhere along the way, anyone not in this room is a potential shooter. This op isn't over until we are back here, okay? Be aware, be vigilant, and stay alert. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men begin rising and readying their gear. The mood is relaxed. Matt walks to the Marshal -- they shake hands an disappear in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever been over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her and offers a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked in Juarez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the DEA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offers nothing further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mexico. As a federal prosecutor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to make sense of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you work for now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go where I'm sent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you sent FROM?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cartagena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Colombia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt emerges from the other room carrying two M4 carbines a Kevlar vest. Macy sees him and marches to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Handing her the vest) See if this fits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pointing toward Alejandro) Is he CIA? Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a DOD advisor, just like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't budge, holds his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay attention to Alejandro -- he says do something, do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes that as a `yes'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not authorized to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shifts her weight. Hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't want to, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanna know what I'm getting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked to get on this train. Because you KNOW you're not stopping anything in Phoenix. You're just sweeping up the mess. In six months, every house you raid will be rigged with explosives... You want to find the men responsible? This is where we start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, she follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE CHEVY TAHOES, sirens on the dashboard move through E Paso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch from above as they cut their way through traffic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy sits in the back beside Alejandro. He holds a rifle between his legs, barrel pointed down. Macy notices his r hand -- his finger rests on the button that rolls down th window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how nervous should I be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DEA Agent riding shotgun turns back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there? That's the beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back, facing front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks out the window to Juarez. It is so close, you c throw a frisbee into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CONVOY turns onto the BRIDGE OF THE AMERICAS. Border Agents have closed the left lane to traffic, in preparati for the convoy's arrival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From above, we see MEXICO. Some THIRTY FEDERAL POLICE TRU SOLDIERS FILLING THE BEDS are waiting for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy drives straight through -- the Mexican Police trucks roll forward as our convoy catches up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city of Juarez is   itself a crime. Filthy and crumbl hookers and criminals   fill every possible space of side They are as plentiful   as the unfortunate masses that ar condemned to live and   work here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWEAT rolls down Macy's face. She can feel her heart beating... Loud enough she actually wonders if others hea too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At every turn, it seems there are soldiers and police. A large group of police can be seen on a side-street, stand around a car -- a DEAD BODY on the street beside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy sees a woman in her 20's SPRINTING down the street, SCREAMING, though there is no one chasing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro taps her on the shoulder, motions her to scoot toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to see Juarez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to A BRIDGE WHERE THE BODY OF A MAN HANGS, a do soldiers looking down at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we look closer, we see he has been decapitated -- his replaced with that of a pig, crudely sewn to his body wit fishing line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body is naked from the waist down -- a state police s on his torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the convoy races up the street, the bridge and it's swinging corpse come closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to believe, yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Breathless) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wears the state police shirt. The pig -- Not what you think it means. All state police work for the cartels. ALL of them. That man... He tried to work for two... he got greedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue past. Into an even worse part of Juarez, if that's possible. The vehicles come to a stop. POPPING SOU can be heard. Like fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cracks his window. The sound floods in. GUNFIRE. Not t shots, not fifty. Hundreds. It is a battle. Over the radi HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody hold on. Mexicans are adjusting our route. There's activity ahead we need to go around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sit here, listening to the gunfight as it builds in intensity. We hear a series of explosions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both agents in the front seats reposition their rifles. Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy rolls again. Makes a left, drives away from th battle as though they were avoiding road construction. A blocks and they all snake right. Macy is trying hard not be terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the convoy picks up speed. Moving 70mph over a that barely qualifies as two lanes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race past a park. A large building can be seen on th right. The Mexican flag flies in front. Numerous Federal Police vehicles in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy stops in front and the Delta operators are out their vehicles, setting a perimeter. The Marshals and Mat emerge and move straight to the building, two Deltas foll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy stays glued to the front door of the building. Waiti Alejandro shifts in his seat toward Macy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing will happen here. If they try anything, it will be at the border. If no lane is cleared for us when we return... Be ready. Watch the cars. Look for old cars. Throw aways. Not gangster cars... Those are for the whores on Saturday night. Did you watch the cars we passed driving in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head `no'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch for state police. They are all bad. We will lose the escort at the loop. You will see. That is when you worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and the Marshals come out with a man covered in a blanket. He is placed in the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The federal Police begin turning their vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the Tahoe lurches forward -- moving between the vehicle with Matt and the Marshals -- acting as a shield. Macy looks out the window at the Federal Police trucks. S notices the agent riding shotgun has his rifle at the rea in the direction of the Federal Police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lean back, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to find him pointing his rifle almost at her he She leans back, and moves her hands toward her ears, read cover them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tahoe begins moving and performs a lighting fast thre point turn, and just like that we are headed north.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy lets out an endless sigh of relief. We are driving v fast now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy looks out the windshield, the hills of El Paso loom the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two streets over, as buildings whip by, we see a STATE PO VEHICLE even with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It disappears as buildings fill our view, then at the nex block we see it again. We hear over the radio --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a spotter on the left everyone. Keep your eyes out for a strike vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver speaks into his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mexico holding a lane for us at the border?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my understanding. We're trying to confirm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we race to the border, the state police vehicle has DISAPPEARED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We come to the loop, the last exit before being fed into twelve lanes leading only to the border crossing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the loop, the Mexican Federal Police vehicles peel off leaving the convoy alone. At the border, US HOMELAND SECU OFFICERS can be seen standing with rifles, making a very public show of force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no lane cleared for them, and just like that -- are trapped in traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stay in this lane. Our agents at the border are going to wave everyone through and get us over as quick as they can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agents at the border aren't even checking passports, moving cars through in the lane where the convoy is trapp but there are fifty cars ahead of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro looks out his window and sees, two lanes over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR MEN in an old Buick LeSabre. They are staring straig ahead. All drenched in sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro taps Macy, she scoots closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a service weapon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unholsters her pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silver LeSabre. Two lanes over my 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silver LeSabre, two lanes right, 3 o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One lane over right, 5 o'clock. Burgundy Expedition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three lanes over right, 1 o'clock, green honda civic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy grips her pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Alejandro spots it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun. Buick LeSabre, 3 o'clock, gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flash suppressor of an AK 47 is peeking out in the ba seat. A sweaty, young gunman holds the rifle between his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the rules here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must be engaged to engage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get out of this vehicle and set a perimeter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay in your vehicle. You can do what they do. If they get out you can get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Macy) watch the door handles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars are beginning to move in the convoy's lane. Anot fifteen seconds and they can leave this hell behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready. They can see our lane clearing. If it's coming, it's coming now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a few more cars and the convoy is clear. But that wo mean luck is on their side and luck doesn't live on this of the border.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors to the Expedition swing open. By the time the assassins put a foot to the ground, the Delta operators a out of their cars and halfway to them, rifles raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Macy can react, she is ALONE in the Tahoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even the driver has exited... she is starting to panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think... think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at her pistol, grips it tight. And goes nowhere

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assassins are frozen, guns by their sides. A dozen Americans have weapons trained on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agent riding shotgun stands in front of the Buick, ri pointed at the windshield. Other operators are at the fla of the Civic before their doors are even open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But at the Expedition, men are already out, weapons in th hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The delta operators and Alejandro are yelling at the men Spanish. One retreats to the safety of the back seat, but others know the consequences of a failed hit and they are in checkmate like those in the other cars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assassins, none over twenty years old, yell and cuss threaten as the operators surround them in a semicircle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assassin that exited the drivers seat -- 2 carat diam earrings and no shirt on his skinny chest -- screams in hateful defiance at the operators surrounding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his weapon and ALEJANDRO AND THE OPERATORS FIRE He is obliterated -- They continue firing, surgically kil all the Expedition's crew. Bullets ping through the windshield. Bullets tear the Expedition to shreds. The assassins never fire a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The innocent masses stuck in the crossfire duck out of vi in their vehicles. The streets are instantly empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The noise of the shooting echoes off the asphalt with the force of thunder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy watches through the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT THE FUCK ARE WE DOING                        !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men watching the other vehicles hold targets in their sights. The rest will take their chances with the boss. D even look in the direction of the Americans -- just stare straight ahead, sweating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The operators and Alejandro work their way back to the vehicle. Everyone retreats to their cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid with the AK 47 in the back of the Buick makes a m for his door handle. Alejandro clocks it, puts 10 rounds through the window, killing him and the man beside him be the door is opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy turns away in shock to find:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises an AK 47 to his shoulder -- pointed right at he Before she can think, her gun is raised and firing throug the tinted window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound is deafening. As the man falls out of view, all can hear is the RINGING IN HER EARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro and the agent riding shotgun jump in and roll t windows down and sit out of them like turrets as the vehi start up and race to the border.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass the guard house without stopping, Border Agents waving them onward through the finish line. More agents p weapons and scream at the Mexican State police officers w have emerged from their offices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is absolute madness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro and the agent sit back in the vehicles and roll the windows... They are back in America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy struggles to get her breath. No one speaks. After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to be on the front page of every newspaper in America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it won't. It won't even make the paper in El Paso...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy is safe. It races past traffic, red sirens lighting the dashboards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vehicles pull in and park. Agents and operators exit vehicles and amble toward the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy gets out, her head spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt walks up to her. She holds out a hand, begging him a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUST... Give me a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That got a little nutty, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. Don't... NO. This isn't ... This was a SPECIAL OP. You're a fucking spook. And HIM!! Who the fuck is that??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points at Alejandro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets her vent. Burning the unused adrenaline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I told you to stay here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not qualified for this. I'm good at what I do, but I'm not a soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sell yourself short. Reason Reggie's home is I know he's not ready for this, but he's gonna have to get ready real quick, because this is the future. Juarez is what happens when they dig in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't put me in a situation where I have to break the law to stay alive. Don't do that to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve walks up to Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna get cracking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On that note, I think you better stay out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt winks and walks in the building, leaving Macy alone the motor pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens and we find GUILLERMO, 45, fat, three day stubble, and very unhappy to be here. His hands are cuffe behind his back. A DEA AGENT holds a bottle of water that Guillermo sucks like an infant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giving him a belly full of water... you devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt smiles, the agent smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt sits in the only other chair in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't think we'd get you here, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it when they don't hablo. Brought an old buddy of yours. Bet you `hablo' to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Alejandro walks in, carrying two five gallon jugs of water. It takes Guillermo a minute, then horror washes over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Medellin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro, he remembers you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No expression on Alejandro's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DEA Agent moves to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna step out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the door behind him. The red `record' button on camera mounted in the corner goes out. We notice a DRAIN THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro walks toward Guillermo, stands across from him. Places a foot on his chest. Pushes... Hard... Guillermo s back, like a chopped tree. He moves through frame in slow motion, falling out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy leans against a car. Spots a guy with a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Got another one of those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her one. Lights it. She draws in, coughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been a while. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like fireworks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and sees a Delta operator. Holding a pair of BINOLULARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She follows him. They walk to the back of the motor pool stairway that leads to the roof of the building. He goes She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes the bait. Climbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit on the edge of the roof, facing Juarez. He begin glassing the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fireworks is code for something, I assume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glasses. She smokes, waiting for the other shoe to dro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees it. Muzzle flashes. Right on the street. Rifle f glowing white against the muddy gray of Juarez at dusk. G as fast as it came. She looks at Delta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins scanning the city. Sirens. Everywhere. She see another muzzle flash. She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't. Too far away. Keep looking. They're everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scans the city slowly. Sirens. More sirens. The city lit in a throbbing red and blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madness, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bums a drag from her cigarette. They sit in silence an watch the city go to war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy, Matt, and Alejandro walk through the parking lot. M is exhausted. Matt's on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can they get them all in one place? No... I'm on a clock now, I can't wait... No, contact Bob Fiske. Have him hold all of them at the staging center.( Turns to Macy) How far is Tuscon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From here? Little over two hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be there a little after 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not what Macy wanted to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to Tucson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta learn how to sleep on a plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie leans against the Tahoe. Not very happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They let me on the base when this peckerwood needs a ride, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pleasant as can be) Has nothing to do with your race. I just don't believe you're good enough at your job yet to be of any use. Kate's sure fond of you, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, man. I feel much better now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie spots Alejandro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy shakes her head, doesn't have the strength to go int it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to Tucson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Alejandro get in the back seat of the Tahoe. We in on Alejandro's emotionless face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods and yawns at the same time. Reggie takes her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... How was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves toward the front of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now's not the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb in. Reggie looks over at Macy staring out the window, resting her heavy head on her fist. He looks back Matt and Alejandro, both already asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team walks from their parked car toward an irate BOB FISKE, 40'S, walking toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the deal, Matt? Why you holding up my transports?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to feed these bastards when we hold em. Know how an internal auditor responds to an eight thousand dollar check to fucking Domino's Pizza?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so dramatic, Bob. This is Kate Macy with the FBI, and her partner `what's his name'... It was her call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't introduce Alejandro and Bob doesn't ask- Kate notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know what we're doing here. (Pointing to his cigarette) Got another one of those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish it before we get inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her one, lights her as they walk. The giant, dom warehouse growing closer. The dull murmur of four hundred people talking and sitting and moving and complaining is wafting out like an odor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy tries to suck the entire cigarette in one drag. Regg leans into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened in El Paso? Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We weren't in El Paso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were in Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie stops. Macy doesn't. She reaches the door and flic the smoke on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The illegals have been separated by sex and criminal reco

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women on the left... The worker bees -- the busboys and landscapers and construction workers -- are in the center and in the back, lined up against the wall, the felons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three dozen HOMELAND SECURITY AGENTS   stand over them wi M4s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go. I'm starting the buses. When you're done with em, send em out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the women can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coulda told me that on the phone, Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First I've heard it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head toward the group of felons and the like as the women are moved out to the buses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch these men close. Look for the ones like the men you saw in Juarez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy looks at him. His kind, sad demeanor seems to settle her. She knows he is offering her something, just doesn't know why. She turns to the men against the wall. They hav their hands behind their backs, zip tied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scans their faces. Many have tattoos, shaved heads. A boy, maybe 18, haircut like a pop star from the 90's. Dia earrings, stares hard at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Keep looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She studies more faces. The ones that look like American gangsters- they look down, away, no eye contact. But the with mustaches no longer in style, hair parted down the middle, the lanky teens with Polo shirts, they stare defiantly. No fear of consequence from American officers. subtle as the differences are- how they wear their pants, they lean against the wall... she understands now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Alejandro, but he is gone. She turns around he stands thirty feet back beside Matt, looking over the migrants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy walks back to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two ways to find drug routes. You can play cat and mouse with those clowns, or ask these guys what trails they avoid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk toward the largest group, the simple migrants. ones that are filthy, tired. Eager to either be sent back Mexico or go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see it all, and must avoid the traps set everywhere for them. We look for one who is older... one who has had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You done with these behind you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agents begin yelling and marching the smuggler group Alejandro turns to Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break them into groups of four, Let them spread out, each group as far from the other as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob huddles his agents and begins explaining as Matt and Alejandro walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Reggie, observing from the entrance. He's had enou `not knowing', walks to Macy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing here?(Looks her over) What were you doing in Mexico??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with you, alright. I don't have answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's get some then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I haven't asked these questions. Think you can do better? MATT. Can we talk to you for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts walking toward them. They head for the open warehouse door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macy and Reggie stop in the center of the parking lot. Ma catches up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This feels very serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we looking for? There's in the dark and then there's the way you're treating us. I want to know the objective, or I walk. Period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go. I didn't ask you to be a part of this. She did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I walk too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie stares at Matt, who casually smiles, pacifying the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you like to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillermo told us about a tunnel east of Nogales, near Sasabe. So now, we're trying to find what areas near there migrants avoid. Because that's where the tunnel will be. Better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillermo is...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He TOLD you where a drug tunnel is... Just... Told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillermo didn't have any other options. We send him back across the border and he's a dead man. Had to give us something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look man, we have a boss, and you ain't him. Be straight. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to make enough noise that Manuel Diaz is called back to Mexico to see HIS boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we know where his boss is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fausto Alarcon, Manuel's cousin... Manuel's boss... He is an executioner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alejandro stands beside them, but looks out over the blac desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When people die in my country, it is with his hand or his blessing. To find him would be like... discovering a vaccine. Manuel will lead us to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His kind, hollow eyes meet Reggie's. Alejandro manufactur smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly, you understand the value of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
